name: radicle
description: Bring support for the Radicle network to your VS code.
author: Konstantinos Maninakis <konstantinos.maninakis@sclable.com>

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run verify-deps && npm run test && npm run lint && npm run build
scripts.dev: npm run verify-deps && npm run build -- --watch --sourceMap

commands.title: Push local changes to the network
Pull latest changes from the network
Show everything the extension has logged

viewsWelcome.contents:
No folder is currently open in your workspace.
To use Radicle, you must open a folder containing a git repository.
[Open Folder](command:workbench.action.files.openFolder)

The folder currently opened in your workspace is not a git code repository.
To use Radicle, you can initialize the folder as a code repository enabling source control features powered by git.
[Initialize Repository](command:git.init?%5Btrue%5D)
[Choose a Different Folder](command:workbench.action.files.openFolder)
To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read the docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/sourcecontrol/overview).

The git repository currently opened in your workspace is not yet initialized with Radicle.
To use Radicle, you can run `rad init` in your terminal after ensuring that the Radicle CLI is installed on your machine.
Once initialized,you'll have access to advanced source control and project management features powered by git and Radicle.
For more help, please read the [Getting Started Guide](https://radicle.xyz/get-started.html).

The git repository currently opened in your workspace is not yet published on the Radicle network.
To use Radicle, you can run `rad push` in your terminal after ensuring that the Radicle CLI is installed on your machine.
Once published, your repository will be hosted publicly on the free, peer-to-peer Radicle network and you'll have access to advanced source control and project management features powered by git and Radicle.
For more help, please read the [Getting Started Guide](https://radicle.xyz/get-started.html).

Use the buttons below to perform common interactions with the Radicle network.
[$(rad-push) Push](command:extension.push)
[$(rad-pull) Pull](command:extension.pull)
[$(rad-sync) Sync](command:extension.sync)
